content: मनस् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [मन्यतेऽनेन, मन् करणे असुन्] {@--1@} The mind, heart, understanding, perception, intelligence; as in सुमनस्, दुर्मनस् &c {@--2@} (In <ab>phil.</ab>) The mind or internal organ of perception and cognition, the instrument by which objects of sense affect the soul; (in Nyāya <ab>phil.</ab> मनस् is regarded as a Dravya or substance, and is distinct from आत्मन् or the soul); तदेव सुखदुःखाद्युपलब्धिसाधनमिंद्रियं प्रतिजीवं भिन्नमणु नित्यं च <ls>Tarka K.</ls> {@--3@} Conscience, the faculty of discrimination or judgment. {@--4@} Thought, idea, fancy, imagination, conception; पश्यन्नदूरान्मनसाप्यधृष्यं <ls>Ku. 3. 51</ls>; <ls>R. 2. 27</ls>; कायेन वाचा मनसापि शश्वत् <ls n="R.">5. 5</ls>; मनसापि न विप्रियं मया (कृतपूर्वं) <ls n="R.">8. 52</ls>. {@--5@} Design, purpose, intention. {@--6@} Will, wish, desire, inclination; in this sense मनस् is frequently used with the infinitive form with the final म् dropped, and forms adjectives; अयं जनः प्रष्टुमनास्तपोधने <ls>Ku. 5. 40</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> काम. {@--7@} Reflection. {@--8@} Disposition, temper, mood. {@--9@} Spirit, energy, mettle. {@--10@} <ab>N.</ab> of the lake called Mānasa. {@--11@} Breath or living soul. {@--12@} Desire, longing after. (मनसा गम् &c. to think of, contemplate, remember; <ls>Ku. 2. 63</ls>; मनः कृ to fix the mind upon, direct the thoughts towards, with <ab>dat.</ab> or <ab>loc.</ab>; मनो बंध् to fix the heart or affection upon; अभिलाषे मनो बबंधान्यरसान् विलंघ्य सा <ls>R. 3. 4</ls>; मनः समाधा to collect oneself; मनसि उद्भू to cross the mind; मनसि कृ to think, to bear in mind; to resolve, determine, think of). {%<ab>N. B.</ab>%} In <ab>comp.</ab> मनस् is changed to मनो before अ and soft consonants, as मनोऽनुग, मनोज्ञ, मनोहर &c.
